subject: Leadership
title: Influence Without Authority
description: A quick win: understand Influence Without Authority.

hook.text: A project manager has no direct reports yet delivers complex projects across five departments. How? Pure influence.

buildup.text: Influence without authority means persuading people you don't control. It relies on trust, reciprocity, and credibility.

discovery.text: Cialdini's six principles: reciprocity, commitment, social proof, authority, liking, and scarcity. Master them all.

twist.text: Formal authority actually weakens persuasion. People comply but don't commit. Influence earns genuine buy-in.

climax.text: Build influence by giving first, finding common ground, and showing how your ask serves others' goals, not just yours.

punchline.text: Real power comes from making people want to follow, not have to.

quiz.question: Why does formal authority sometimes weaken persuasion?
options: Authority makes people listen more carefully
